CONFIDENTIAL MEMO
TO;
NAEB Board
FROM:
W. G. Harley
DATE:
February 14* 1961
I hereby resume my former practice when president of sending out more-oi -less
monthly memos to the directors in order that they may be made au courant with
current activities and can, in turn, be responsive to them . The Newsletter,, perforce,
can only report on matters appropriate for general attention; obviously, there are many
activities in various stages of development about which the directors ought to be
informed but which would not be appropriate for public announcement.
1 conceive of my role to be that of providing leadership in making recommendations
and initiating projects; yours to react in terms of policy guidance and advice * In order
to profit from your counsel* I need to keep you fully informed of what8s transpiring
or is being contemplated* I trust in this way that we can develop a closer and more
helpful relationship between the Board and the Headquarters staff.
Accordingly, I welcome your comments. Feel free, if you wish, to scribble on
the margins or back of these memos and return. All reaction is helpful.
1. Depending somewhat on how things develop in relation to (1) Board
reaction to the proposed letter of agreement on NAEB-NETRC (a copy of which will
be distributed shortly) and (2) on how matters work out in actual practice between
now and then as to NAEB-NETRC relationships, I suggest that we plan to have
Jack White and Jim Robertson join the Board for lunch following our Board meeting
in Milwaukee* March 14.
2 . NAEB has been asked to plan a session on educational radio for the
DAVI convention in Miami, April 24-28. These dates, unfortunately, largely
conflict with those of the IERT. Since I felt it was important both from the standÂ¬
point of inter-organizational relationships and of promoting radio that we accept
the invitation, I agreed to take the assignment on April 22, even though it means
(1) having to fiy out immediately to be in Columbus the following noon and (2) having
to switch the NAEB Board meeting to Saturday after IERT {April 29). We can't have
the Board meeting Friday night because of the IERT Awards Banquet. However, if
we start at 9 am Saturday and meet through lunch, we ought to be able to conclude
by 4: 00 pm in time for most everybody to get home that night. I regret this switch
but felt the considerations justified it
